conclusion: Initial conditions: Car speed 30 m/s, Truck speed 10 m/s, Initial distance 30 m.
The car decelerates to 20 m/s in 1 s and continues to decelerate until its speed matches the truck's speed (10 m/s).
Time calculation: Car's speed decreases to 20 m/s in 1 s, additional time needed to match truck's speed.
Total time to reach 10 m/s is 4 s.
Distance traveled by car: Average speed 20 m/s, Distance = 80 m in 4 s.
Distance traveled by truck: 40 m in 4 s.
Relative position calculation: Total distance car needs to cover is 70 m.
Car covers 80 m while truck covers 40 m, car will catch up to the truck.
Final answer: Yes, the two vehicles will collide.
